Dialogue: Uhgh, there's water everywhere...  Can I get a cigarette?

Dialogue: I miss him too...

Dialogue: Mom!!!!

Dialogue: I think this is probably for the best. He's a very old dog. He has arthritis. He has cataracts in his eyes...

Dialogue: Doctor Matthews, your son is on line one. He says it's an emergency...

Dialogue: Oh Jesus...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Dad...

Dialogue: Hey! What did I just say?

Dialogue: Ass-hole...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Did she always have reporters following her around like this?

Dialogue: Pretty much so.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I hear you moved into town.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I wanted to get Geoff out of L.A. Just start things over, you know?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I remember when Renee left. She couldn't wait to get out of Ludlow. She used to say that life moved too slow here...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: That's Renee alright.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I suppose so.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: ...Geoff, what if we just give the clothes to Goodwill? We'll keep the rest. Just the clothes.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: You're the one who wanted to move. Nobody would've touched them if you didn't want to move here...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: All the 'Renee' boxes go in the attic. Sorry.

Dialogue: Hi. I'm Marjorie Hargrove. Your new housekeeper.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Is something wrong?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Uh... no. You just... look different than you sounded on the phone. Please, come in.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: I'm real excited about working for you Mr. Matthews...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Well we're glad to have you, Marjorie. You can call me Chase, by the way.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: I've always admired Ms. Hallow. That scene she did in Blue Midnight, where her lover meets her at the train station...  I must've watched that movie four times.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Oh. I'll get that...

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: This is gorgeous. She wore this at the Emmys, didn't she?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Hey, don't touch her stuff. It made her crazy when people touched her stuff.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: This doesn't look so bad...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: How long ago did this guy retire?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: It's been a few years.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: A few?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: What's wrong?!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Nothing. I just got spooked by a bunch of furballs.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Great, now I've opened an orphanage too.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Well, I'll take one. If it's okay...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: She looks like a tiger.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Tell you what, you do some sweeping up here, and she's yours.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Sorry. He gets kinda hyper...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Hell, he thought it was lunch. How ya doin', Chase?  Drew, where the hell are your manners.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: He's a cool lookin' dog.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: What's his name?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Zowie.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Damn dog stuck his nose in on my rabbits and they ganged up on him. I swear that dog's an idiot.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Is he gonna be okay?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Let's have him hop up here.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: When I was young I thought cats were the girls and dogs were the boys.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: There are three more girls where that one came from looking for homes.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Not our home.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Thee facial lacerations should heal up pretty quickly. I'll give you som antibiotic cream--

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: --Drew, he's your dog. Are you listening to this?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: His left eye is scratched, corneal abrasion. Eyedrops will help, but it's going to take som time. Try to keep him away from those rabbits, huh?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I hear you've got Marjorie Hargrove working for you now.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: How'd you know that?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: It's a small town, Chase.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Hey Geoff, did you know your mother and I used to be high- school sweethearts?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Course that was a lifetime ago.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: What's a lunch cost these days? You want ten?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Sure.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: You nervous? New town, new school. I know it must be pretty hard for you...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I'll be fine, Dad.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff... you have to help me out here a little...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Are you sure you don't want me to pick you up. It's a long ride.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: That's what my bike's for...

Speaker: priceless kittens
Dialogue: FREE TO A GOOD HOME

Dialogue: Check it out. That's the new kid. The son of that movie star.

Dialogue: Hey, what's Hollywood like? Do you know Eddie Murphy?

Dialogue: No.

Dialogue: What about Julia Roberts?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: What's the hurry, Junior? Where you off to?

Dialogue: Too bad about your Mom. Papers said it was pretty gross, getting fried like that. Guess you saw it, huh?

Dialogue: So, what are you hiding there?

Speaker: stevie
Dialogue: When you bring a friend to school you're supposed to introduce him.

Dialogue: Her name's Tiger.

Dialogue: Tiger? Don't you think that's kind of a pussy name?  Can I hold her? I promise I'll be real careful.

Dialogue: Hey, Geoff. You ever seen a kitten run?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I've seen her run around the house.

Dialogue: No, I mean really run...  Like this!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Shit...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Having fun yet?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Just give me the cat, all right?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: I would but... there was a little accident...  ...but I happen to be out of them at the moment.

Dialogue: Come on, Clyde, just tell him where the cat is...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: ...I TOLD HIM where the cat is! Now shut up, fuck-face!

Dialogue: You heard about the Creed murders yet? And the place where the dead come back to life?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: It's just back there. Just down that path...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Clyde... it's not funny anymore.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oh? So you got a problem? What're you gonna do, fat-ass? You gonna sic big, bad, old Gus after me?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: What do you think, Geoff? Maybe you could dig up your Mom and take her back there. Maybe if you pray real hard, she'll come back.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Just give me the cat, ass-hole.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Excuse me, maybe I'm a little hard of hearing... but did you just call me an ass-hole?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: You mad, Geoff? Cause if you are, you should take a shot at me...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Come on, you pussy! What's the matter with you?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Fuckin' ass-hole.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: This way, fat-boy.

Dialogue: I've never seen anybody punch Clyde before.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: He pissed me off.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I couldn't handle not having my mom around. Just having Gus...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: My dad's not so bad.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I swear, sometimes I wish Gus was dead...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: You shouldn't ever say that about your parents, not even your Dad.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Stepdad. Gus is my stepdad.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: What was all that stuff about dead people coming back to life?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Nothing. It's just an old ghost story. Let's get out of here...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Hey! How was your first day at school?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: It sucked.

Dialogue: Now is that any way to talk to your father?

Dialogue: You're not my mother.

Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Way to go, Romeo...

Dialogue: Drew, I don't remember inviting Zowie in for dinner.

Dialogue: Just until he heals up?

Dialogue: Gus, please...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: God damn, you're good.

Dialogue: You're breaking the law here, Drew.

Dialogue: Really, Gus. It won't bother me.

Dialogue: Your mom's spent the last hour cooking. Stop being a little jerk and show her some appreciation.

Dialogue: Not that much appreciation. I thought we were gonna tone down that flabby ass.

Dialogue: Hey, I'm so sorry I'm not the stud that you are.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Knock it off, guys...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You watch that mouth of yours, Drew buddy.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Damn it, Drew. That dog is history!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Don't shoot him!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: What, Drew? What did you say?!

Dialogue: Jesus, Gus, what have you done?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Ah, come on, Amanda, stop looking at me like that. He's had ample warning about that dog.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I was just going by your house. Where's your bike?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Zowie's dead.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I have to bury him. I don't want to go out there alone.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Is this a good spot?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I'm not burying him here...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Why not?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: There's a better place...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: It's back here somewhere, through the Indian woods. I know we can find it...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Hey, wait up!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Drew, where are we going?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: This is it... I wasn't sure if it even really existed.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: What did?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: The old Indian burial ground.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Come on, that's just a bullshit story. You said so yourself...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: What if it's not bullshit? If I bury Zowie there, and it works...  ...he'll come back alive.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Drew, I know your dog died, but... get a grip, man, you're freaking me out.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Look, if there was even one chance in a million it'd work, wouldn't you want to try?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Look, let's just get this over with.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: If this doesn't work... don't ever tell anyone I did this, okay? You gotta promise...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: You want me to help?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: You have to bury your own. That's the way the Indians did it. It's like a rule...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: What if he really does come back?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I've never had anyone die before...  ...but I guess you get over it. I mean, eventually...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: You never get over it.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: It's getting pretty late. We better go.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: So long, Zowie...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Get in.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Your momma's worried sick over you. You take off in the middle of the night, you don't show up for school. What're you trying to prove?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I'm not trying to prove anything.  I was burying my dog.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Life is full of lessons. No one's above it. Not you. Not me... Now get in the car.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Zowie?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: What did I do now?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Open the door, Drew.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Where do you come off lying like that? "I'm burying my dog." You think a lie like that's never gonna catch up to you?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Zowie...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Say your goodbyes. Zowie's going outside. You're grounded, buddy. That's the new law.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: I never knew an open wound could smell so bad...  Honey, he should have been looked at this morning. I don't know what you were thinking. It's a wonder he's still alive.

Dialogue: Geoff...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: You alright?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Dad... do you think...  ...you think you and Mom would've gotten back together?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I think so.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Your Mom and I loved each other, Geoff. Don't ever think that we didn't.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I still can't believe she's dead...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Remember Zowie, Drew's dog? He got hurt again. I'm going over to take a look at him.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I'm going with you.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: How'd it happen?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Some psycho hunter probably got trigger happy...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I'm going to give Zowie a local anaesthetic so I can clean up the wound. I'd like to take him home tonight for observation.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Can you keep him at your place until he gets better?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Sure...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Maybe he wasn't dead when we buried him.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: He was dead. You know he was.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: You can't tell anyone, Geoff. Ever.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Mom!!!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: What's the deal?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I don't know. He's had three days. His immune system should've responded by now...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I can't seem to find a pulse... it must be so weak, it's not registering...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: We'll take him back to the kennels, Dad.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: You think my Dad'll figure out why he's not getting better?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: You think he'd believe it if he did?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: How can he not have a heartbeat?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Maybe it takes a while...

Dialogue: So who're you going as, Wayne Gretzky?

Dialogue: I'm going as Jason.

Dialogue: Jason? Who's he play for?

Dialogue: He doesn't. He hacks people up.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I'm late.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Hey! Where're you off to?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I'm going out, Dad!

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Out?

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: He's probably going up to the Pet Sematary. Kids've been going out there on Halloween night for years.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: What do they do up there?

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Oh, you know... drink beer, tell ghost stories. They try and spook each other out, talking about zombies and things...  It's no big deal, Chase. I did it when I was young.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Hold still. Hold still.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You make sure you're home by ten. If Gus finds out I let you go...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I'll be home, Mom. Don't worry. I won't let Gus blow up again...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Drew, I know Gus isn't your father, but you never even knew your real father. He walked out on the both of us, and you remember that.  Gus isn't that way. He has it in him to love us both. You just have to give him a chance...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Look at this, Junior here practically shit his pants.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Maybe you're too chicken to hang out with the rest of the boys. You gonna run home to Daddy now?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Fuck off.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: You're home early.

Dialogue: Nope. Just ran out of smokes.

Dialogue: Where's the boy?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Uh... in his room...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: God damn it, Amanda! You want me to be a father to the boy, and as soon as I lay down the law, you let him break it!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Where is he?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: WHERE IS YOUR SON!?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: The Pet Sematary.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: ...yeah, that old Louis was one sick fuck... digging up little Gage like so, maggots pouring out of that kid's eyes...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Ellie was the only Creed that lived. Then one night a few months later, Ellie freaks out, and she hacks up her grandparents with an axe!  Police found her licking their brains off the blade... They locked her up in a psycho ward and all she said were two words: 'Pet Sematary. Pet Sematary.'

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oh yeah! Almost forgot! Here's the best part. Two nights ago she escapes. Word is, she was heading for Maine. Man I hope she doesn't show up out here.  Shit, we wouldn't even notice her, not if she's wearing a costume. She could be one of us...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oh my Goddd!!!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: It's... It's...

Dialogue: Shit! It's Drew's Dad. It's fuckin' Gus!

Dialogue: You boys better not be drinking!

Dialogue: Oh man, he's gonna kick my ass...

Dialogue: Thanks for fucking up our Halloween, dumbshit!

Dialogue: Drew, you get your ass out here! Front and center!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Get out here, Joker.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You out here making a fool of me?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I'm warning you, buddy! You don't play by the rules, I'm gonna shadow your ass for eternity!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You little shit!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You get out of here, Geoff Matthews! This is between me and my boy!

Dialogue: Call off your dog, Drew.

Dialogue: Drew, call him off!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Zowie...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: DREW!

Dialogue: Oh, God. Oh, God...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Is he dead?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Is he breathing? Can you hear him breathing?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Oh man, Geoff... we killed him... we killed him...  What're we gonna do?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: We could bring him back.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Jesus, Drew, do you know what time it is? Did Gus ever find you?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Drew? Drew, what happened?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Nothing happened, Mom. We just ditched Gus, that's all...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Were you drinking?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Drew's Mom called hours ago, the rest of the kids were back by ten. Where the hell were you boys?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Just out.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: "Out." Well that's great, Geoff.  Look, I've been letting you get away with a lot these past few weeks, but I'm not going to stand for crap like this. I don't care if it's Halloween... it's a school night, and if you do this again...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I'm really tired, Dad... can I just go to sleep?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Go on... we'll talk about this in the morning.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Gus?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: H-how'd you get in?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Found 'em.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I'm makin' a mess of your mother's kitchen floor...  I need a shower...

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Gus, hon. I'm sorry about tonight. You coming to bed?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: God, you're ice cold...  ...and you smell! Lord, what did you get yourself into?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: My God, Gus, what happened?

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Gus... stop it! What's wrong with you?!

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: Gus!!!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Well?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Picture this... Gus comes down to breakfast and he doesn't say a word. He even kind of smiles, like he forgot he hates me. And then you know what he does? He serves me an extra helping of pancakes...  I asked him if I was still grounded... "no." I asked him if you could spend the night, and he nods. It's like we're a family. A real family.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: It's weird...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: It's like he's not Gus anymore. He's different. You know, like Zowie...

Speaker: message machine
Dialogue: ...Doctor Matthews, this is Elliot Rudman at the university. I've looked over the blood specimen you sent us on canine Zowie...

Speaker: mother
Dialogue: We saw your sign. Are there any kitties left?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Take your pick. They're in the boarding area. You can go on back.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Elliot, it's Chase...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I didn't get that...

Speaker: rudman
Dialogue: ...I said next time it might help if you took the blood sample while the animal was still alive...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: rudman
Dialogue: I don't know what you expected to find, Matthews. There's nothing wrong with the antigens, nothing to indicate an unusual death...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Wait, there must be some mix-up. He was... the dog is alive.

Speaker: rudman
Dialogue: Not this dog. There wasn't enough oxygen in those red cells to pump life into a flea.

Speaker: rudman
Dialogue: You took over for Doctor Yolander?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Yes... why?

Speaker: rudman
Dialogue: Because the last person that sent me blood from a dead animal was Yolander...

Dialogue: Where are the kitties?

Dialogue: Look, this is ridiculous...

Dialogue: Jesus...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Hey!

Dialogue: Saved by the bell...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Can I sleep over at Drew's tonight?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Yeah... that's fine...  Listen, Drew, I got the tests back on Zowie. He's not well. Don't ask me how, but he got out this afternoon...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: If he finds his way home, call me, no matter what the hour, okay? And don't try to approach him. Whatever he's got might be infectious. Understand?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Can I have the address for Quentin Yolander?

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: You'd be so much more interesting with blue eyes...

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: I'm immortalizing a poodle. State your business!

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: Why are you bothering me about this? Can't you leave it be?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: ...the pathologist... he said that you had reported a similar incident... with a cat...

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: The Creed cat, that's right. Bastard's name was "Church".  Let me guess. Your dog's tissue isn't healing, pupils aren't dilating... maybe you can't find a heartbeat?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Exactly! I thought it might be some sort of blood condition... immune deficiency or...

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: There's no "blood condition." The dog isn't sick, it's dead.  And so was Creed's cat. And so was his wife the night she was killed for the second time...

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: You want some advice, friend? You get in your car, you pick up your family... and you get the hell out of that town.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Well... uh... thanks...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I guess we're having rabbit for dinner.

Speaker: amanda
Dialogue: God damnit, Gus! This isn't funny!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: What was that all about? You think he's trying to scare us?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I don't know but I'm not taking any chances...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Chase. I miss you so much...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Renee...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Oh God...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: I can come back, Chase...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: No... Too heavy.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: ...can't breathe... I can't...

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: I didn't mean to... I was going to empty the hamper...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: It's okay.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: What happened to you?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I had a little run-in with Zowie.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: You sure did...

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Here, let me do that...

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: I hope he doesn't have rabies.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: He doesn't. I don't know what he has, but I'm hoping to God it's not infectious...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Marjorie... what do you know about the Creed murders?

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Did you ever play that game where you pass a story down a row of people and see how screwed up it gets by the time it's done? People say Louis Creed's son came back from the dead and it drove him crazy...  He killed his wife and himself, and that's the end of story. Anything else belongs in the National Enquirer.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Sorry. Now tell me what that has to do with Zowie?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: I wish I knew.

Speaker: librarian
Dialogue: What are you looking for, Hon.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Do you have anything on the Creed murders? I can't find the microfilm from that period...

Speaker: librarian
Dialogue: We don't keep anything on file from that far back.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: But you've got files from the previous years...

Speaker: librarian
Dialogue: We have nothing on the Creed murders, sir. Can I get you something else?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Do you think everyone that came back would be like Gus?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I don't know...  ...maybe it depends on what you were like before you...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Dies?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I gotta go back and do my chores...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Go later...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: I can't. Gus'd kill me if I showed up late.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: See you at school Monday?

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: You ever think about running away?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: All the time.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: See ya!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Well look who's here!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oops!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Guess your Dad's not here to save you now, is he?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: You ever seen a tire take off a nose?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Neither have I.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Might even kill ya. Wheel might chew right into your brains. You could visit your mom.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, Gus!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Go home.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I said... GO HOME!!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Come on, Gus, I was just fucking with him...  What're you gonna do? Give me a ticket? I mean, shit, Gus...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: You can't lay a finger on me...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Gus... what are you doing?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I'm just fucking with you...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Stop it, man! Stop it!!!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Whoops.

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Oh man...

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: No, Zowie! It's me!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Stay back!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Forget something, Drew buddy?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You have the right to remain silent...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: ...while I bash your fucking head in!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You have the right to a lawyer, but you won't need one...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: ...cause you'll be dead!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Gus killed Clyde, Mom! He's trying to kill me!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Drew, buddy! Daddy's not done yet!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Go Mom! Go!!!

Speaker: drew
Dialogue: Mom!!!

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ... Friends and neighbors came to pay respects for Drew and Amanda Gilbert, who died in a head-on collision Saturday...

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Those poor people. I saw Gus this morning... he looked terrible.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff, dinner's ready!  Geoff?!

Speaker: newscaster
Dialogue: ...in other news, the disappearance of a Ludlow youth remains a mystery. Clyde Parker was last seen on Saturday afternoon. His motorcycle was

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff... what are you doing?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I'm getting things ready for Mom.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Mom is dead, Geoff. You know that...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: She doesn't have to be.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: I can bring her back. The same way Drew and me brought Zowie back...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff, this is crazy. Zowie didn't die.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: He did. We buried him.  There's a place out in the woods... if you bury something there, it comes back alive.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: We tried it on Zowie first. And then we did it again, when Zowie killed Gus. Drew didn't want Gus to be dead, so we brought him back, too...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Look, Geoff. Just... just relax, okay. I'm going to take this call and I'll be right back. Okay?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: What?! Christ, I'll be right there...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Marjorie, I need you to stay late. Geoff is really upset and I have to take care of this. Don't let him leave the house, alright?

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: I need you, Geoff...

Speaker: caretaker
Dialogue: ...sorry to disturb you, Doctor Matthews, but I thought you'd want to come have a look for yourself. It's the damndest thing...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Jesus...  Gus did this?!

Speaker: caretaker
Dialogue: He put your wife in his truck and drove off right through Amanda and Drew's headstones...

Speaker: caretaker
Dialogue: I swear, nothing this weird has happened since Louis Creed dug up his boy...  You want me to notify the authorities?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Doctor Yolander, this is Chase Matthews, we spoke the other day...

Speaker: yolander's voice
Dialogue: You didn't leave town, did you.

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: You sorry bastard. You stayed. I have nothing more to say to you, Matthews...

Speaker: chase's voice
Dialogue: Look, just tell me one thing. Did I treat an animal that had been brought back to life? Did I?!

Speaker: yolander
Dialogue: What do you think?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: My God...  ...how is that possible? You have to help me, Doctor Yolander. I don't know what I'm dealing with here! They've dug up my wife...

Speaker: yolander's voice
Dialogue: God help you...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Wait! Don't hang up!

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Shit!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You bury your own, Geoff.

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Geoff?

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Geoff? You okay up there?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Jesus...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Gus, what are you doing?!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: I was building a doggy door.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: God damn it Gus, you dug up my wife! What the fuck is going on around here?!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: A little drilling. A little killing.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Holy shit!

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: God I hate when that happens...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: You got a permit for that?

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Didn't think so.

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: No brain, no pain, Chase. Think about it...

Speaker: gus
Dialogue: Just remember, Chase... I had Renee first... and now I'm gonna have her last...

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff!

Speaker: marjorie
Dialogue: Jesus, Geoff! Don't sneak up on me like that!

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Did you really think you could be like me?

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Such a young face... but you've got potential...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: We'll do the eyes first. You always start with the eyes...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Marjorie? You know you're not supposed to be in the attic.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Mom...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: I came back for you, Geoff. We're going to be together again.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Marjorie?

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Hello, Chase.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Oh my God...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: We can try again, Chase. We can make it work this time.

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Don't you love me anymore, Chase?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: You're not Renee... Renee's dead...  Geoff! Get over here now!

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Geoff, honey, why don't you go downstairs. Your father and I need a moment alone. Do it for me?

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Geoff...

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: I love you.

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Hey, Junior. Wanna play?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: Geoff!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Oops! Looks like Daddy got a boo- boo...

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Now, where were we?

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Here it comes, buddy! HERE IT FUCKING COMES!!!

Speaker: clyde
Dialogue: Eat it, ass-hole...

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: EAT THIS!!!

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: Don't leave me alone!

Speaker: renee
Dialogue: NO, GEOFF! NO!!!

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: All set?

Speaker: chase
Dialogue: All set.

Speaker: geoff
Dialogue: Anywhere but here.
